entry.et: Middle English, from Old English dropa; akin to Old High German tropfo drop

def.dt: :the quantity of fluid that falls in one spherical mass
:a dose of medicine measured by drops eye drops for dilating the pupil of the eye
:a minute quantity or degree of something nonmaterial or intangible
:a small quantity of drink
:the smallest practical unit of liquid measure
:something that resembles a liquid drop: as
:a pendent ornament attached to a piece of jewelry
:an earring with such a pendant
:a small globular cookie or candy
:the act or an instance of dropping :fall
:a decline in quantity or quality
:a descent by parachute
:the people or equipment dropped by parachute
:a place or central depository to which something (as mail, money, or stolen property) is brought for distribution or transmission
:the act of depositing something at such a place made the drop
:the distance from a higher to a lower level or through which something drops
:a decrease in electric potential
:a slot into which something is to be dropped
:something that drops, hangs, or falls: as
:a movable plate that covers the keyhole of a lock
:an unframed piece of cloth stage scenery
:drop curtain
:a hinged platform on a gallows
:a fallen fruit
:the advantage of having an opponent covered with a firearm
:advantage superiority usually used in the phrase get the drop on
:a move back from the line of scrimmage (as in preparation for making a forward pass) a quick drop

dro.drp: at the drop of a hat

def.dt: :as soon as the slightest provocation is given :immediately
:a part so small as to be negligible
:to fall in drops
:to fall unexpectedly or suddenly
:to descend from one line or level to another
:to fall in a state of collapse or death
:to become played by reason of the obligation to follow suit
:to fall or roll into a hole or basket
:to enter or pass as if without conscious effort of will into some state, condition, or activity dropped into sleep
:to cease to be of concern :lapse let the matter drop
:to pass from view or notice :disappear often used with out drop out of sight
:to become less production dropped often used with off
:to move with a favoring wind or current usually used with down
:to let fall :cause to fall
:give up 2 abandon drop an idea drop the charges
:discontinue dropped what she was doing
:to break off an association or connection with :dismiss drop a failing student
:to utter or mention in a casual way drop a suggestion drop names
:write drop us a line soon
:to lower or cause to descend from one level or position to another
:to cause to lessen or decrease :reduce dropped his speed
:to give birth to
:lose dropped three games dropped $50 in a poker game
:spend drop $20 for lunch
:to get rid of dropped 20 pounds
:to bring down with a shot or a blow
:to cause (a high card) to fall
:to toss or roll into a hole or basket drop a putt
:to deposit or deliver during a usually brief stop usually used with off drop the kids off at school
:air-drop
:to cause (the voice) to be less loud
:to leave (a letter representing a speech sound) unsounded drop the g in running
:to leave out in writing :omit
:to draw from an external point drop a perpendicular to the line
:to take (a drug) orally :swallow drop acid
:to inform authorities (as police) of another's wrongdoing
:to fail to keep up
:to make a mistake especially by failing to take timely, effective, or proper action
:retreat
:to move straight back from the line of scrimmage the quarterback drops back to pass
:to pay a brief casual visit
:to visit casually or unexpectedly drop by a friend's house
:a protective sheet (as of cloth or plastic) used especially by painters to cover floors and furniture
:a stage curtain that can be lowered and raised
:sensationally striking, attractive, or impressive a drop–dead evening gown
:pull-down a drop–down menu
:to forge between dies by means of a drop hammer or punch press
:a hinged cover on the front of a desk that may be lowered to provide a surface for writing
